context_meta.title: Tiangong-1: China's Out-of-Control Space Station Will Crash Into Earth in Just Weeks, Likely to Hit Northern U.S. States
context_meta.summary: China’s Tiangong-1 is expected to re-enter the atmosphere and crash into Earth in just a few weeks, scientists have warned. The Aerospace Corporation, a California-based non-profit research and development organization, predicted the 8.5-ton space station will collide into the earth's atmosphere in the first week of April, with the error of margin at a week on either side. The European Space Agency estimates the module will crash sometime between March 24 and April 19. Although experts have not yet determined exactly where the out-of-control module will land, an Aerospace report detailed that it will likely re-enter somewhere in the northern U.S. states, parts of South America, northern China, the Middle east, central Italy, northern Spain, New Zealand, the south of Africa or Tasmania in Australia.

context_meta.title: Here's the average income in every state — and what it's really worth
context_meta.summary: The worth of your annual income can be determined by measuring it against the "regional price parity." The higher the price parity figure for a given state, the more locals will pay for living expenses and housing. In New York, for example, the median household income is $60,850, but only amounts to $52,775 in terms of worth. Geography can transform a paycheck. That is: How much your wages are actually worth depends largely on where you live. On some level, everyone understands that — even if you don't have a firm grasp on precisely how far a $50,000 salary would go in California, compared with, say, Ohio. context_meta.title: Microsoft co-founder finds lost World War II aircraft carrier near Australia
context_meta.summary: An expedition team led by Paul Allen, the billionaire explorer and the co-founder of Microsoft, said it's discovered the missing wreckage of an American aircraft carrier that went down during World War II.Allen and his team located the long-lost USS Lexington, one of the first American carriers, about 500 miles northeast of Australia in the Coral Sea, he said in a post on his website. Using Allen’s personal vessel, the R/V Petrel, the team on Sunday discovered the wrecked ship about 2 miles deep, along with 11 of the 35 planes that went down with it, according to the post.The carrier, nicknamed "Lady Lex," went down in 1942 during the Battle of the Coral Sea. “To pay tribute to the USS Lexington and the brave men that served on her is an honor,” Allen said in a statement.

Related Cos. subsidiary Hudson Yards Construction LLC brought the claim in New York State court against the Building and Construction Trades Council of Greater New York, a union umbrella group. “In the month of February 2015 alone, for the privilege of selling coffee and snacks at the Project, Coffee Boy #1 was compensated for 155 hours work, of which 45 hours were classified as overtime payable at time and a half or $69.87 per hour including benefits,” the lawsuit charged.

context_meta.title: Actress Blanca Blanco wears a red gown to the Oscars that's basically a 'wardrobe malfunction waiting to happen'
context_meta.summary: Blanca Blanco, the actress who made a statement at the Golden Globes by wearing a red dress while a majority of the other attendees opted for black gowns to protest sexual harassment in the entertainment industry, is back with another standout look.
